Q. What is the possibility of there ever being a world government? (1) Short answer: Never say never.Very, very low possibility.Because of the highly onerous necessary and sufficient conditions.Based on current global sentiments (Brexit, rise of Nationalism, Alt-Right, Trump’s America First, Catalan crisis), the outlook is dank.(2) If there is ever a so-called One World Government (OWG), it won’t be a situation where, suddenly, all countries had a simultaneous global epiphany overnight, that it’s a great insight, and then lets-do-it. (3) These’re the run-up necessary conditions, and steps. The EU gets past the current Brexit and populist nationalism psyche phase. The EU is a mini, forerunner, test case, an OWG of sorts. If the EU is not holding up, and strengthening, we can forget the larger OWG concept.In a similar vein to the EU situation above, the world at large gets past the current populist anti-globalization, nationalist mental block. Right now, as of 2017, it doesn’t look good. The Alt-Right, Trump phenomenon, Bernie Sanders phenomenon, Marine Le Pen, nationalist parties, NAFTA renegotiation, Catalan independence agitation (as of Nov 2017). A hairball.The globalization modus operandi to-date is not working well. Countries benefit from globalization in aggregate. But, there is simmering injustice in the unwieldy undergrowth. The winners of globalization such as young, educated, skilled, urban professionals lap up the benefits, but carry none of the economic and social costs. The losers of globalization, such as lower-educated, lower-skilled, older, rural folks suck up all the costs, get the short shrift, get shafted, enjoy minimal incidental benefits. OWG is bigtime ambitious globalization. If large swathes of the population are disenfranchised, the system can’t be sustained. There has to be more equitable sharing of the benefits and costs to make globalization hum on an even tone.Assuming we get past the above EU, populist, nationalist, globalization winners-vs-losers sentiments and challenges, there’re are more EU-like entities, e.g. in South East Asia (ASEAN), North East Asia, Latin America, Africa. These are consolidated Lego-like building block modules to eventually compound into a larger monolithic OWG.It’s in the nature of humanity that people will voluntarily favor collectivism, buy-in to the sum of the parts is synergistically larger than the whole, when there is relative broadbased prosperity. Self-evidently, people want to share prosperity, not share shit. There must be an enough fund of prosperity to go round for sharing. E.g. the EU was born in an era of high Western European prosperity. Thus, the OWG will only happen when swimming in a similar sea of global prosperity. Prosperity papers over differences. It lubricates the massive challenges involved in negotiations, resolving differences, making the OWG a reality.
